short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Sorts tabs left-2-right by URL - ignoring www. prefix. Works with extensions like The Great Suspender.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
If you use many tabs, sorting them by domain keeps related things in proximity so that you switch between tabs pretty quick. The problem is, that while you surf around, you open up new pages, search things etc. and after a small fraction of time, all tabs are un-sorted again.

No longer, just click the UrlTabSort button and everything is re-arranged.

The extension ignores www. pre-fixes so that you know where to look for your tab in the tab bar. More the left or right. Pretty simple and quick navigation.
